What's On

Our carefully curated programme is designed to bring you exciting new theatre, laugh-out-loud comedy and a diverse range of live music acts.

SUS

, theatre

Set on the eve of the Thatcher victory in 1979. The sus laws made it legal for police to stop and search anyone – purely on suspicion. Election night 1979. Two detectives on the graveyard shift in an East London police station place bets on which party will win. Delroy is brought in ‘on suspicion’. The interrogation takes all night. The country wakes up to a new Conservative government. Sus is a powerful and politicised cry against the still-current threat of institutional racism. Keeffe pulls no punches with his depiction of a corrupt world which looks all too familiar today.

Tickets £14.00 (plus booking fee). Book tickets through Online Ticket Seller, or in venue.

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

  • Book Tickets

Happenings

, theatre

In these tough times, Life’s a struggle. There’s unfulfilled expectations. Humdrum existences needing an injection of life. Millions wishing something, would happen to them, to fill the void in their lives. Clearly everyone “else” is happy. Online celebrations and holiday pics prove it. Jane can’t take it anymore. She needs that something, anything! but how far is she willing to go to get it? If you purchased a ticket or tickets for the original run of Happenings at the Grove in December 2020, but were unable to attend on account of being resident in a then-Tier 3 or 4 area, you may exchange your ticket(s) for either of these two performances. Please contact us at grovetheatreeastbourne@gmail.com for your exchange to be processed. This does not apply to those who received refunds on their tickets.

Printers at the Grove, a new play by John Berry

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

SUS

, theatre

Set on the eve of the Thatcher victory in 1979. The sus laws made it legal for police to stop and search anyone – purely on suspicion. Election night 1979. Two detectives on the graveyard shift in an East London police station place bets on which party will win. Delroy is brought in ‘on suspicion’. The interrogation takes all night. The country wakes up to a new Conservative government. Sus is a powerful and politicised cry against the still-current threat of institutional racism. Keeffe pulls no punches with his depiction of a corrupt world which looks all too familiar today.

Tickets £14.00 (plus booking fee). Book tickets through Online Ticket Seller, or in venue.

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Play Reading Workshops

13:00 Monday 1 Nov 2021, workshops

£60 per course £10 per session. Starts Monday September 20th 1-3pm 6 week script reading course, 2 hour workshop each week reading a full script. Looking at the things we did/didn’t like, giving feedback on the project. Email us to book: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

£60 per course £10 per session. Nov 1st to Dec 6th Mondays 1-3pm

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Room To Rant

18:30 Monday 1 Nov 2021, spoken-word

Room to Rant is a space for young men to rap and get stuff off their chest. The rap and spoken word initiative that tackles men’s mental health is in action across Brighton, Worthing, Crawley, Eastbourne and online. The rap sessions are led by highly-experienced and accomplished rappers who are well respected in the Brighton hip-hop and music scene. Members are encouraged to be themselves; talking and exploring struggles and life experiences through spoken word, rap and hip hop. No prior rapping experience is needed at these relaxed, free-to-attend, weekly drop-ins, where young men build on lyric-writing and improvisation skills. The groups can still meet despite Covid-19 and there is one online group for those who can’t meet in-person. Anyone who identifies as male or non-binary aged 16-25 is welcome to attend Room To Rant.

Mondays, 18.30 till 20.30 Free

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

IMPROBOOTS

12:30 Tuesday 2 Nov 2021, workshops

Improvisation is a skill used in all walks of life to build confidence, free the imagination and improve communication. It's also a huge amount of fun. Join us for our inclusive, accessible, *failure free* environment for games, exercises and challenges led by actor/director Florence Bell.

£60 6 week course Sept 28th Tuesdays at 12.30 - 2.30pm Email us to book: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Beginners Chair Yoga

13:00 Thursday 4 Nov 2021, workshops

Ashley from Lotus Lessons will support you through a gentle chair based practice that is focused on mindful movement and meditation. Sessions are accessible for all with modifications given where needed.

Beginners Yoga - Weekly £10 Thur 1pm-12pm

Fireworks With The Golgis

21:00 Friday 5 Nov 2021, music

The South East's Premier Absurdist Pantomime Acoustic Theatre Art Alternative Folk Rock Band. Attempting to build on the huge success of their hit single 'It's Still a Hoover' (number 173 in the Billingshurst chart), The Golgis have now discovered even more instruments they are unable to play properly.

21:00, Free entry.

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

PPH Birthday Party

19:30 Saturday 13 Nov 2021, event

Join the PPH family from 7.30pm in celebrating another year at Grove Road and over 6 years of being the best Theatre, Live Music Venue and Arts Hub in Eastbourne! We have a jam packed line up of Game show games, performances from the choir and The Ukulele Army, a special Open Stage set and live music from The Great Fire! Theme is Black and Gold, so get your PPH colours on and make sure you've booked your table by emailing ross@printersplayhouse.co.uk

19:30, Free.

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

20:00 Wednesday 17 Nov 2021, event

Holding Space

10:00 Thursday 18 Nov 2021, community

If you are a parent/carer looking after a child who is struggling with their mental health why not pop in and meet other parents. Relaxed group offering a safe, confidential space; time to chat, connect and share with one another. Know that you are not alone as a parent.

Holding Space is a free Monthly group starting Thursdays 10am-11.30am

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Troubadours - Ben Walker + Kirsty Merryn

20:00 Saturday 20 Nov 2021, music

"Troubadours" is the regular roots music evening at PPH featuring top artists in folk, country, acoustic rock and everything in between - plus local support! Ben Walker and Kirsty Merryn.... Saturday 20th November. 8 pm. In The Playhouse. Tickets £8 Supported by Hayley Savage BBC Folk Award Winner Ben Walker joins forces with highly acclaimed singer and pianist Kirsty Merryn to create a fresh take on a tradition ripe for rediscovery... "Life and the Land" is a celebration of England's harvest tradition, re-imagining songs born out of our agricultural past. Ben Walker was recently hailed as 'one of the best acoustic guitarists in the world right now' (Total Guitar magazine) and 'a great guitarist composer and producer' (Mark Radcliffe, BBC Folk Show). With his work sought out from punk to Proms, from Rough Trade to the Royal Shakespeare Company, his passion is putting old jewels into new settings. He has been involved in over 50 albums as performer and producer, and his new solo LP 'Echos' has received universal critical acclaim. Kirsty Merryn launched her debut album 'She and I' in 2017 whilst supporting folk behemoths Show of Hands on their UK cathedrals tour. Her follow-up 'Our Bright Night' was chosen by The Guardian as their Folk Album of the Month.

19:30pm, £8

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

  • Book Tickets

Play Reading Workshops

13:00 Monday 22 Nov 2021, workshops

£60 per course £10 per session. Starts Monday September 20th 1-3pm 6 week script reading course, 2 hour workshop each week reading a full script. Looking at the things we did/didn’t like, giving feedback on the project. Email us to book: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

£60 per course £10 per session. Nov 1st to Dec 6th Mondays 1-3pm

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Room To Rant

18:30 Monday 22 Nov 2021, spoken-word

Room to Rant is a space for young men to rap and get stuff off their chest. The rap and spoken word initiative that tackles men’s mental health is in action across Brighton, Worthing, Crawley, Eastbourne and online. The rap sessions are led by highly-experienced and accomplished rappers who are well respected in the Brighton hip-hop and music scene. Members are encouraged to be themselves; talking and exploring struggles and life experiences through spoken word, rap and hip hop. No prior rapping experience is needed at these relaxed, free-to-attend, weekly drop-ins, where young men build on lyric-writing and improvisation skills. The groups can still meet despite Covid-19 and there is one online group for those who can’t meet in-person. Anyone who identifies as male or non-binary aged 16-25 is welcome to attend Room To Rant.

Mondays, 18.30 till 20.30 Free

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

IMPROBOOTS

12:30 Tuesday 23 Nov 2021, workshops

Improvisation is a skill used in all walks of life to build confidence, free the imagination and improve communication. It's also a huge amount of fun. Join us for our inclusive, accessible, *failure free* environment for games, exercises and challenges led by actor/director Florence Bell.

£50 per course, £10 per session Nov 9th to Dec 7th Tuesdays at 12.30 - 2.30pm Email us to book: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Wendy Saves Santa

19:30 Saturday 18 Dec 2021, theatre

Wendy is having 'issues', she can't cope with modern life but she'd rather find her answers at the bottom of a glass rather than in the company of friends. But then an old friend...from Neverland...pays her a visit and whisks her away to the far off magical land to save the day once more, because Captain Hook is having no trouble at all coping with modern life...he's making a million a day exploiting the dreams of children, and he's even gone so far as to kidnap Santa to get what he wants. Can Wendy save Christmas Day for all the children around the world? Come to Printer's Playhouse over Christmas to find out.

Tickets: £14, Concession £11, Child £8 Plus Booking Fee

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Ringing the Devil's Doorbell

19:30 Saturday 29 Jan 2022, theatre

'Ringing the Devil’s Doorbell' is the third in a series of monologues exploring characters from Twelfth Night and will next year be incorporated into one show to be called ‘The Twelfth Night Trilogy’ (though will also remain as a separate solo play). The Devil’s Doorbell sees Viola confronting issues of identity, sexuality and hidden agendas in a world of masks and disguises. It opens with Viola in the aftermath of the destruction of the club Jo Jo. The play contains live music from actress and accomplished accordion player Hannah Harris, with songs by Jacques Brel.

Tickets: £14, Concession £11, Child £8 Plus Booking Fee

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

AK Patterson in Concert!

20:00 Saturday 5 Feb 2022, music

The return of this wonderful artist with her trio on a UK tour! More details to follow soon.......

£10 plus booking fee

IMPROBOOTS

12:30 Tuesday 8 Feb 2022, workshops

Improvisation is a skill used in all walks of life to build confidence, free the imagination and improve communication. It's also a huge amount of fun. Join us for our inclusive, accessible, *failure free* environment for games, exercises and challenges led by actor/director Florence Bell.

£60 per course, £10 per session Jan 11th to Feb 15th Tuesdays at 12.30 - 2.30pm Email us to book: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Play Reading Workshops

13:00 Monday 14 Feb 2022, workshops

£60 per course £10 per session. Starts Monday September 20th 1-3pm 6 week script reading course, 2 hour workshop each week reading a full script. Looking at the things we did/didn’t like, giving feedback on the project. Email us to book: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

£60 per course £10 per session. Jan 10th to Feb 14th Mondays 1-3pm

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
